name: misconceive
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to understand something incorrectly, or to think that something is different to the way it really is: But the film's creators misconceive the true nature of corruption. It claims that these lawyers are wrong, lacking in insight and perception, that they misconceive their own behaviour.
More examplesFewer examplesMarlena points out that Jewish dishes are not universally the heavy, stodgy meals we misconceive them to be.The exercise at best fundamentally misconceived the Movement's nature and aspirations.In short, modelling human beings as essentially self-interested utility maximisers misconceives radically the nature of humankind.
